docs.lead_paragraph: lion. CLARKSON F. CROSBY died in this City yesterday morning, after an illness of some months' duration. It has already been stated that he had but recently returned from the South, whither he had journeyed for the benefit of his health, and that on reaching this City he found himself too feeble to proceed to his home in West Troy.

headline.main: WASHINGTON'S BIRTHDAY.; The Celebration in the City.

docs.abstract: Address to the O.U.A. at the Academy of Music
docs.lead_paragraph: The O. U. A. 's at the Academy of Music--Military Parade--Oration by Hon. Erastus Brooks--Young Democrats' Ball, The 126th anniversary of the birthday of WASHINGTON was duly honored in this City and vicinity yesterday. The elements did not by any means favor a military display,

docs.snippet: The sober town of Philadelphia is this Winter rejoicing in positive excitements; and as anything like an excitement is a godsend in that respectable city, the people cannot refrain from perpetuating the expression of their delight. The introduction...

headline.main: What our Neighbors in Philadelphia are Doing.

docs.lead_paragraph: The sober town of Philadelphia is this Winter rejoicing in positive excitements; and as anything like an excitement is a godsend in that respectable city, the people cannot refrain from perpetuating the expression of their delight. The introduction of city passenger railways has been the event of the season. The opening of the Southwark and Frankford line, a few weeks since, produced an era.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM HAVANA.; The Slave-Trade-A Bold Murder-Difference between Commodore Paulding and the Consul General at Havana-Carnival Festivities. Arrival of the Black Warrior-Settlement of Hispano-Mexican Quarrel.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail Steamer Black Warrior, J. W SMITH, Commander, from New-Orleans 12th inst., and Havana 15th, arrived on Saturday evening, having encountered strong head winds and seas the entire run from Havana. Two cargoes of negroes have been landed since last advices. The American ships Kate Hooper and Challenge had arrived with cargoes of coolies.
